Job description

  • Permanent opportunity
  • Join a growing team

This is a challenging end-to-end Systems Administrator (Infrastructure) position working with a dedicated team supporting a national technical environment.
\xa0
We are seeking a pro-active Infrastructure specialist who brings extensive experience working on Microsoft technology stacks, Citrix / VMware\xa0and Microsoft Azure / Office 365.
\xa0
To be successful in this role you will have a strong customer service mentality with excellent communication\xa0skills in being able to deal with internal users and business stakeholders.

Day to day responsibilities:

  • Working within the IT Infrastructure team dealing directly with end-users and business stakeholders.
  • Design, build and support new Infrastructure technologies and services.
  • Integrate new business applications into the infrastructure environment.
  • Ensure documentation and procedures are always up to date.
  • Perform routine status checks and produce reports.
  • Maintain and review configuration data (e.g. User lists, asset register etc.)
  • Patch Infrastructure systems when required to policy and architectural standards.
  • Front line support of the Microsoft Exchange, Windows, MS Office 365 and Citrix Xenapp desktop environments.
  • Managing virtualised infrastructure (VMware, Esxi etc..).
  • Remote Access management.
  • Taking ownership of issues escalated to 3rd line support and external vendors.


Skills & experience required:
  • 5 + years' experience in an IT Systems Engineer / Administration role.
  • 3 + years' experience with Microsoft\xa0Office 365 (migration, design and deployment).
  • Strong experience with Windows Exchange Servers - Enterprise.
  • Hyper-v build and administration
  • Advanced knowledge of virtualization with VMware.
  • Strong experience in Citrix.'
  • Cloud experience with Azure.
  • Application and OS (desktop and server) installation, configuration and hardening.
  • Advanced knowledge of Active Directory, Group Policies, DNS, DHCP
  • SAN Storage experience.
  • Working knowledge of SCCM & SCOM.
  • Experience with Nutanix for Enterprise Cloud support.
  • Hands on experience of supporting and troubleshooting virtualised installations / environments.
  • Microsoft and VMware certifications preferred e.g MCP, MCSE, VCP etc.


This is a rewarding position to join a high performing team working with a National leader in their field.

913048490:
[

Uber Eats Operations Manager, Sydney

Company Name Uber Company Location Sydney, AU

New Posted Date Posted 4 hours ago Number of views 3 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world.

We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let’s move the world forward, together.

About The Role

As an Uber Eats Operations Manager in Marketplace Experience, you will think through the eyes of our three customers, Eaters, Restaurants and Delivery Partners, to improve their experience and ultimately drive growth the growth of Uber Eats in NSW and ACT.

You will you build out and execute projects in line with our strategic objectives and will always be looking to solve the problems which arise in this rapidly evolving industry.

What You’ll Do
  • Work closely with other teams in Sales, Marketing and Central Operations, to establish and build a growth strategy for Uber Eats in NSW and ACT.
  • You’ll look through the eyes of our customers to understand their needs, and implement solutions which improve their experience with Uber Eats.
  • You’ll use data (both internal and external) to identify opportunities in your city that will to help Uber Eats grow and improve our customers experience.
  • You’ll drive projects that scale not just across the cities we operate in NSW and ACT, but also around the region.
  • You’ll help build and lead a high performing team the ensures we meet our business objectives.

What You’ll Need
  • 4-7 years of experience in high performing work environment with record of progression
  • Commercial acumen (business sense)
  • Strong project management skills
  • A proven track record of managing a wide range of different stakeholders while driving business objectives
  • A clear understanding of our marketplace including core metrics and levers to drive value for Eaters, Restaurants, Delivery Partners and our own business (profitability and brand)
  • The ability to prioritise focus areas based on impact to the business in short, mid and long term
  • Data driven decision making including basic data modelling and the ability to draw key insights from analysis.
  • You are willing and able to quickly pivot to action to hit deadlines and address urgent issues.
  • Innovative problem solving skills - you can generate innovative and customer focused ideas to improve the customer experience across the platform; looks to the future with visions of exciting opportunities. Can make ideas reality.
  • Able to build processes to affect sustainable and scalable change
  • A track record of building trusting relationships with customers, partners, suppliers or teams to deliver mutually beneficial results.
  • Evidence of incorporating qualitative insights into decision making both as an individual and to bring insights to wider teams
  • A track record of going above and beyond to achieve results and deliver against commitments
  • Passion for customer experience. You have a curiosity and empathy for our users across Eaters, Delivery Partners and Restaurant Partners

About The Team

With Uber Eats, we’re building Uber’s newest and fastest growing business, spanning 180+ cities across all six continents in two years. Today, Uber Eats is available across many parts of APAC including Mumbai, Hyderabad, Chennai, Bangalore, Tokyo, Hong Kong, Singapore, Bangkok, Auckland, Wellington, Sydney, Perth, Brisbane, Adelaide and Melbourne -- and we’re just getting started.

Industry

  • Consumer Services
  • Information Technology and Services

New Posted Date Posted 8 hours ago Number of views 13 views

Job description

  • Are you experienced and pragmatic B2B marketer?
  • Deliver initiatives that support the implementation of CSIRO’s commercialisation strategy
  • Join CSIRO’s dynamic Corporate Affairs team

\xa0

The Position: \xa0

We are seeking a driven, energetic and strategic senior marketing advisor to join our Corporate Affairs team to deliver initiatives that support the implementation CSIRO’s commercialisation strategy. We have a formidable track record when it comes to turning world class research into globally adopted commercial opportunities and we are looking for the right person to promote our position as Australia’s innovation catalyst.

\xa0

In this newly created role, you will be part of Brand and Marketing team and will work closely with the Business Development and Commercial team, leveraging their knowledge to implement integrated marketing solutions to drive brand awareness, engagement and advocacy.

\xa0

Your duties will include:

  • Create, execute and monitor marketing plans that support the implementation of CSIRO's Commercialisation strategy.
  • Deliver campaigns and events that raise CSIRO's profile in target markets, supports the commercialisation framework, driving awareness and engagement.
  • Develop and implement internal campaigns promoting a culture of commercialisation.
  • Coordinate and monitor campaign effectiveness and reporting; assisting Corporate Affairs to continuously improve and demonstrate outcomes.
  • Manage constructive relationships with external agencies to deliver campaign objectives.
  • Show initiative and work effectively as a member of a highly distributed team to deliver high quality outcomes with autonomy.

\xa0

Location:\xa0 North Ryde, NSW or Clayton, VIC

Salary: \xa0 \xa0 \xa0AU$97K to AU$105K plus up to 15.4% superannuation

Tenure: \xa0 \xa0 Specified Term until June 2020
Ref no: \xa0 \xa0 \xa058914


To be considered you will have:

  • Relevant tertiary qualification and work experience in marketing, business management or commerce.
  • Eight years marketing experience in a business-to-business environment.
  • Evidence of successfully developing and implementing strategic marketing initiatives and associated campaigns in a business-to-business context, resulting in new opportunities identified, business growth and new markets.
  • Proven skills in building strong partnerships with stakeholders to develop organisational and cross-functional marketing initiatives that translate into business opportunities.
  • Demonstrated understanding and/or experience in the following areas:
    • Integrated marketing communication (offline / online)
    • Campaign development and analysis including CRM/segmentation
    • Brand management
    • Public relations
    • Content marketing
    • Stakeholder engagement
    • Event management.

\xa0

Before applying please view the full position details and selection criteria here:

https://jobs.csiro.au/job/Sydney%2C-NSW-Senior-Marketing-Advisor%2C-Commercialisation/511303200/

\xa0

We work flexibly at CSIRO, offering a range of options for how, when and where you work. Talk to us about how this role could be flexible for you. Find out more Balance

\xa0

About CSIRO

At CSIRO, we do the extraordinary every day. We innovate for tomorrow and help improve today – for our customers, all Australians and the world. We do this by using science and technology to solve real issues. Diversity is the compass that navigates our innovation. We provide an inclusive workplace that respects, values and actively pursues the benefits of a diverse workforce.

\xa0

We imagine. We collaborate. We innovate.

911612459:
[

Senior Content Producer, Design School

Company Name Canva Company Location 2 Lacey Street , Surry Hills, NSW 2010, AU

New Posted Date Posted 8 hours ago Number of views 46 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

At Canva, we create tools that empower the world to design. Our mission is to make design simple for everyone. Inspired by a team of talented thinkers, an amazing culture and remarkable growth trajectory – we’re out to change the world, one design at a time.

Launched in August 2013, our platform combines a drag-and-drop design tool that is used by more than 10 million users across 190 different countries who have created more than 850 million designs (that’s 20 designs created every second). And we’ve only achieved about 1% of what we’re capable of …

The mission of Canva’s Design School is to help empower everyone in the world to design. Our goal is to build the best online “campus” to learn design in the world, and boost retention and engagement with Canva’s platform by providing inspirational content, how-to videos, interactive tutorials and foster a global community to support each other.

A strategically minded producer, you’ll drive the content roadmap and execution to build and grow our Design School, which we aspire to take the best parts of Masterclass, Creative Live, and Coursera and become known as the best place to learn design. You’ll bring together a host of skills to help us build out the best place on the Web to learn design. You’ll have a background in production and instructional design, and know how to create engaging content for the Web.

You’ll work with a talented internal video, design, email, social and product team to bring our Design School to life. While you’ll have some support from an extended team (who are juggling a range of other projects), you’ll be willing to roll up your sleeves and create a lot of our content. You’ll be a metrics-driven producer who can work with a range of stakeholders to develop exceptional content, build an audience, and deliver on business outcomes.

Your responsibilities


  • Plan and prioritise our content development, crafting highly engaging inspirational content across video, written guides, interactive tutorials and peer learning
  • Boost retention across our platform by providing inspiration and empowering our community to create amazing designs using Canva
  • Research a wide range of topics and craft content alongside our internal designer, videographer, content writers and social media editor — you could be producing content on Crafting an Amazing Presentation, Colour Theory, and Building a Brand all at the same time
  • Ability to think visually and analytically to come up with new concepts for our courses and content
  • Project manage the delivery of a number of courses simultaneously, owning the process through research and planning, content development, production, editing, promotion and measurement
  • Upload and curate content on our Design School platform
  • Ability to coordinate diverse teams of people to deliver and execute
  • Work within Canva’s brand (and help further cement) to build consistency\xa0
  • Translate quantitative metrics, design research, user feedback, and user research into a cohesive documentation of lessons and activities
  • Develop educational and interesting assignments & learning tools to accompany lessons


Experience you'll have\xa0

  • Have 5+ years of experience in production, instructional design, and online learning
  • Naturally creative: you don’t need to be a designer, but you need to have an eye for the visual, and the ability to learn quickly
  • You’ll have incredible organisational skills and attention to detail
  • You love data and know how to use both quantitative and qualitative measures to develop and improve content and delivery
  • You demonstrate a high degree of judgement and can juggle a diverse range of priorities
  • Able to influence and work with a wide range of stakeholders
  • Can balance working individually and autonomously with working in and alongside a range of teams — you’re comfortable being part of a team, leading projects, or owning things; whatever the job calls for!
  • While we won’t be taking any blood samples, we’d love to see some Startup DNA – you will need to be flexible, pragmatic, strategic, tenacious, and take ownership of deliverables and outcomes – ya gotta have hustle

910105651:
[

Customer Solutions Engineer

Company Name KONE Corporation Company Location Mascot, AU

New Posted Date Posted 3 hours ago Number of views 2 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Did you know KONE moves over one billion people every day? In 2017, we had annual net sales of EUR 8.9 billion. We employ over 55,000 driven professionals in over 60 countries worldwide joined together by a shared vision. As a global leader in the elevator and escalator industry, it is our mission to improve the flow of urban life.

As a global leader in the elevator and escalator industry, it is our mission to improve the flow of urban life. We believe in improving performance through inspiring, engaging and developing our people. Personal growth is strongly supported and there are significant opportunities for career development. Joining us means you will be part of a global network of people, working in a culture that fosters innovation and empowers you to make a difference.

KONE is embarking on an exciting growth phase and this presents an opportunity for a Mechanical Engineer within the Customer Solutions Engineering (CSE) team to provide technical support to the sales and installation teams in developing, selling and successfully implementing KONE products and service solutions that meet our customer's needs.

The successful candidate will be a self-motivated and goal oriented individual with a customer-focus approach who takes pride in their success. They will own the customer solutions process in terms of prospecting, tendering, defining specifications, details, dimensions, CAD- and lay-out drawings.

As the successful applicant, you will answer customer technical questions and support the sales and installation teams with technical issues.

Being part of an innovative global organisation that actively supports your career and internal promotions, means that for the right person, this role could be a fantastic next step in your career.

What will you be doing?
  • Support the sales and installation teams by analysing customers' technical needs and developing proposals outlining how KONE's products and services can provide clear solutions to meet these needs.
  • Provide technical and costing support for the sales process
  • Coordinate specifications and delivery times with the Supply Line, Sourcing or local subcontractors.
  • Accountable for solution engineering
  • Ensure that the proposed solution fulfils the codes, regulations and safety requirements
  • Technical support in the delivery process
  • Organize the order documentation and order confirmation
  • Manage the drawings and related documents
  • Make the material specifications for KONE and local material
  • Check and update the specification based on contract and variations.
  • Organize the purchasing of the required materials

Are you the one?
  • Experience working in the lift industry will be highly regarded
  • At least 3 to 5 years post graduate mechanical engineering experience
  • Mechanical Engineering degree or related equivalent
  • Proficiency in CAD preferable Autocad
  • Advanced office package skills
  • Strong analytical skills including the ability to determine appropriate solutions for our customers
  • The ability to understand the product delivery chain so that timely and accurate designs are delivered
  • Demonstrated working knowledge of Australian and European standards. Knowledge relating to elevators, escalators and auto walks will be an added advantage
  • Sound technical design experience including experience in VBA or similar programming languages
  • Exposure to major projects within commercial and industrial environments will be preferred
  • Understanding of the tender process and the technical specifications involved
  • Strong attention to detail

What do we offer?
  • Career progression opportunities within a global organisation
  • Full-time role enabling you establish a function and make it your own
  • Total reward elements that engage and motivate our employees and help us make KONE a great place to work
  • Comprehensive learning and development programs covering a wide range of professional skills

Please note: visa sponsorship is not available for this position. All applicants must have full-time, unrestricted rights to work in Australia at the time of application.

KONE is committed to diversity and social inclusion. Applications from people of culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds; equity target groups including women, people with disabilities, people who identify as LGBTIQ; and people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent, are encouraged

Notice To Third Party Agencies

Please note that KONE does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Fee Agreement, KONE will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee.

In the event that a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate to any member of our staff without a previously signed agreement, KONE explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of KONE.

At KONE, we are focused on creating an innovative and collaborative working culture where we value the contribution of each individual. Employee engagement is a key focus area for us and we encourage participation and the sharing of information and ideas. Sustainability is an integral part of our culture and the daily practice. We follow ethical business practices and we seek to develop a culture of working together where co-workers trust and respect each other and good performance is recognized. In being a great place to work, we are proud to offer a range of experiences and opportunities that will help you to achieve your career and personal goals and enable you to live a healthy and balanced life.

Read more on www.kone.com/careers

  • Mechanical or Industrial Engineering

910151477:
[

AWS Cloud Architect

Company Name Amazon Web Services Company Location Sydney, AU

New Posted Date Posted 35 minutes ago Number of views 1 view

Be an early applicant

Job description

Amazon is continuously striving to be the most customer-centric company in the world. AWS have been helping over one million customers in over 190 countries, from Airbnb to GE, to deliver flexibility, scalability and reliability across their organizations. Behind this success is exceptionally talented, bright and driven individuals who work hard, have fun and make history.”
In your role, you will have the opportunity to help shape and deliver on a strategy to build mind share and broad use of Amazon’s utility computing web services within strategic Enterprise accounts. You will represent AWS in face-to-face meetings and own the overall technical relationship between AWS and the customer.

This role will engage with enterprise customers across a broad range of industry verticals including Travel and Transportation, Tourism and Leisure, Fast-Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG), Pharmaceuticals & Healthcare and Business Services. Technology trends in these verticals include IoT, Big Data, Analytics, AI/ML, Serverless and traditional cloud migrations of compute, storage and associated applications.

The Ideal Candidate Will Need To Demonstrate
  • Deep technical skill in infrastructure, software architecture and cloud computing
  • Customer facing skills, ideally gained in presales or consultancy roles, allowing them to represent AWS in discussions with senior personnel
  • Demonstrated ability to think strategically about solutions to business, product, and technical challenges.
  • Awareness of technology trends and how they impact the way businesses consume IT
Roles and Responsibilities
  • Support the AWS Business development team to help formulate a strategy to help the adoption of AWS within the focus industry verticals.
  • Guide customers to ensure success in building and migrating applications, software and services following the principles of the AWS Well-Architected Framework.
  • Help educate enterprise customers on the value proposition of AWS, and participate in deep architectural discussions to ensure solutions are designed for successful deployment in the cloud.
  • Help provide one-to-few and one-to-many training sessions to transfer knowledge to customers considering or already using AWS.
  • Capture and share best-practice knowledge among the AWS solutions architecture community.
  • Author or otherwise contribute to AWS customer-facing publications such as blogs and whitepapers.
  • Build deep relationships with senior technical individuals within customers to enable them to be cloud advocates.

Procurement/Purchasing Specialist - Corporate

Company Name Chandler Macleod Group Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 6 hours ago Number of views 7 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Leading Australian energy provider
  • Melbourne CBD location
  • Immediate start required


Our highly valued client AGL Energy is committed to helping shape a sustainable energy future for Australia.

AGL operate the country's largest electricity generation portfolio, are its largest ASX-listed investor in renewable energy and have more than 3.6 million customer accounts.

Proudly Australian, with more than 180 years of experience, AGL has a responsibility to provide sustainable, secure and affordable energy for our customers. Their aim is to prosper in a carbon-constrained world and build customer advocacy as our industry transforms. That's why they have committed to exiting coal-fired generation by 2050 and why they will continue to develop innovative solutions for their customers.

Key purpose of this role

The Purchasing Specialist - Corporate primary responsibilities are purchasing activities and associated services. This includes purchasing activities such as; converting Purchase Requisitions to Purchase Orders, initiating Request for Quotes, evaluating vendors, negotiating low value purchases, managing contracts and suppliers as well as updating system records. In addition, where required this role will perform services such as; vendor approvals, contract administration, and other purchasing services. This role will have strong relationships with key business stakeholders and offer training where required.

Key accountabilities of this role

Key areas of focus include; Conversion of Purchase Requisitions into Purchase Orders, ensuring timely and competitive pricing of goods and services, strong stakeholder engagement, within the governance requirements outlined in AGL's P2P Policy & Standards.

Primary Responsibilities Include

  • Develop strong relationships with business stakeholders raising requisitions;
  • Identify and highlight opportunities for developing contracts to the relevant Category Managers;
  • Work closely with internal stakeholders to ensure compliance with P2P related policy, process;
  • Monitor and ensure adherence to KPI's and improvement targets in relation to the Corporate Purchasing function;
  • Identify improved ways of managing suppliers to achieve better performance and outcomes;
  • Identify and provide training and support to stakeholders;
  • Manage disputes in order to maintain strong relationships and successful commercial outcomes.
  • Market research for potential vendors
  • Initiate Request for Quotes and compare and evaluate offers from suppliers
  • Negotiate pricing and potentially develop low to medium complexity contracts where required;
  • Manage nominated contracts and participate in supplier reviews to ensure high performance;
  • Maintain ERP system with contractual information;
  • Track orders and ensure timely delivery;
  • Convert Purchase Requisitions into Purchase Orders;
  • Attend trade shows and exhibitions as appropriate to the Corporate portfolio;

    • Qualifications, Key Skills And Experience Required

  • Tertiary qualifications associated with Procurement; Business, Commerce is preferred;
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills including written and presentation skills;
  • Proven ability to work effectively in a matrix management environment;
  • Must display and demonstrate an inherent ability to use effective negotiating and influencing skills in a consultative and constructive manner;
  • Work with key stakeholders and colleagues to improve efficiency, and achieve team KPI's and timelines in accordance with AGL policies and Standards;
  • Develop and maintain effective relationships with other key stakeholders and external suppliers as related to job role;
  • Must be able to demonstrate management of external suppliers and vendors;
  • Must have experience in purchase negotiations;
  • Have an understanding of a mature procurement environment, including purchasing policies and processes;
  • Demonstrated commitment to AGL's values and own personal development;
  • Commercial acumen.

    • So if you are interested in this fantastic opportunity and are available to commence right away, please apply without delay as we are keen to have someone commence asap.

Job description

About St Vincent's Hospital

St Vincent's Hospital Melbourne (SVHM) is part of St Vincent's Health Australia and a leading teaching, research and tertiary health service which employs more than 5,000 staff across 18 sites throughout Melbourne. SVHM provides a diverse range of adult clinical services including acute medical and surgical services, sub-acute care, medical diagnostics, rehabilitation, allied health, mental health, palliative care, correctional health and community residential care. SVHM is one of Australia's leading Catholic not-for-profit healthcare providers.

About The Department

The St Vincent's Heart Centre was opened for business in November 2013. The Heart Centre provides privatised cardiac consulting clinics and all cardiac diagnostic ambulatory services such as: echocardiograms, stress echocardiograms, pacemaker clinics, stress testing, ECG reporting and more.

It is envisaged that the Heart Centre will bring together clinical care, education, research and preventative health under the one roof, further strengthening St Vincent's leading role in tackling heart disease, and significantly improving access for Victorian patients to specialist cardiac services.

The Cardiac Investigation Unit providing a full range of invasive and non-invasive investigations and procedures for inpatients. These services include cardiac catherisation and intervention, pacemaker implantation and checks, echocardiograms, TOE and DCR.

About The Role

An opportunity exists for an Administration Assistant to join the Cardiology Team at St Vincent's Hospital on a Full Time basis. You will work across Cardiology which encompasses The Cardiac Investigation Unit and The Heart Centre.

You will be a dynamic team player who is committed to providing excellent service to our patients/ their families and Cardiology Staff.

Duties
  • Ensure visitors to reception are greeted and assisted in a professional and timely manner projecting a caring, professional image to patients, and their relatives and to referring clinicians
  • Efficient patient scheduling of all ambulatory tests, Cath Lab and TOE lists, Pacemaker and DCR Clinics. Ensuring a referral is received for all bookings from GPs, Registrars and Cardiologists
  • Efficient patient scheduling for consultation clinics in the Heart Centre and CIU, ensuring that Cardiologists run on time and all follow up appointments and investigations are booked

Selection Criteria
  • Describe a time when you were put under pressure with competing priorities and how you managed the situation
  • Describe a time when you have worked effectively as part of a team
  • Describe a time where you have seen an opportunity to improve a process. How did you go about it and what was the outcome?


All appointments are made subject to the candidate providing a current satisfactory National Police Certificate conducted by The Victoria Police.

Member Experience Manager

Company Name ADMA Company Location Sydney, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 67 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Australian Alliance for Data Leadership (AADL) is a network of associations that have a common goal to deliver a future where Australia is recognised globally as a leader in data-enabled, business, commerce and innovation. Our network of associations include:• ADMA - Association for Data-driven Marketing & Advertising• IAPA - Institute of Analytics Professionals of Australia• DGA - Data Governance Australia• Digital + Technology Collective


1. MAIN PURPOSE OF JOB

The Member Experience Manager is responsible for managing and growing association memberships within an assigned territory. Reporting to the Commercial Director, the Member Experience Manager is responsible for members renewing their membership by ensuring they take advantage of their member benefits and to build and manage a pipeline of new revenue (memberships, training and events) from member and non-member organizations assigned.

By maintaining a high volume of calling activity, the Member Experience Manager is also responsible for maintaining the accuracy of our member data and an accurate pipeline of future revenue.

2. POSITION IN ORGANISATION

Reports to:\xa0 \xa0 \xa0Commercial Director

\xa0
Responsible for:\xa0\xa0Membership engagement and retention; servicing members by delivering depth of membership, ensuring delivery of Premium Benefits based on knowledge of member objectives and focus areas, and delivering revenue uplift through upsell and cross-sell opportunities.


Main Relationships: \xa0CEO, MD’s of Associations, MD – Corporate IQ, General Manager Education, Managers, Content & Programming Managers, Marketing & Communications team.\xa0


Position Type:\xa0 \xa0 Full-time\xa0


3. SCOPE OF THE JOB

A. Business development
B. Retention and growth of members through account management and service delivery, with\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0a\xa0 focus on the new Premium Benefits delivery
C. Grow IQ Training revenues within assigned territory
D. Ensure key milestones are met including on-time payment of invoices, renewals
E. Deliver revenue uplift for AADL (all association network)
F. Additional responsibilities as required

4. \xa0 DUTIES AND KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

A. Business Development


• Talk with member contacts once per month
• Identify new revenue opportunities for AADL
• Maintain an accurate pipeline of new business opportunities
• Prospect calls to non-members for AADL association membership and education sales.
• Update changes in member information and ensure CRM data is accurate
• Communicate any Association activities pertinent to the member
• Provide member feedback on requirements and issues relevant to the AADL associations.
• Communicate to members regarding AADL activities and events.


B. Retention and growth of members and through service delivery


• Be knowledgeable about member company; seek to understand member focus area and annual objectives/interest areas.
• Organise quarterly catch ups with members for association GM as needed
• Execute any agreed strategies as part of account planning
• Seek feedback from member surveys
• Ensure delivery of Premium Benefits
• Act as liaison for paid member projects; re-contract paid member and sponsor projects
• Promote key events and activities to members throughout the year to increase engagement\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0for members
• Account manage the use of any training or event credit available to the member and ensure\xa0 \xa0they utilise these benefits.

C. Deliver depth and breadth of membership


• Maintain account plans for key member accounts and deliver quarterly update to Association\xa0 \xa0GM’s
• Deliver key contacts (Primary, Member Contact, CMO, Regulatory Lead for ADMA and other key\xa0 \xa0contacts for other associations and cross-sell opportunities) and ensure details are captured\xa0 \xa0and kept up to date in Salesforce CRM.
• Ensure communication on key member changes to AADL teams
• Deliver key contacts relevant for other AADL associations including CDO, CAO and ensure\xa0 \xa0details are captured and kept up to date in Salesforce CRM.
• Review and capture the preference information for members
• Identify the right people for additional opportunities including executive and other events

D. Ensure key milestones are met including on-time payment of invoices


• Monitor activity levels for members including ensuring regular communication with every\xa0 \xa0member to defined member journey plan
• Ensure all payments including membership invoices are paid on time


E. Deliver revenue uplift for AADL


Maintain a 95% membership renewal rate across all associations
Re-subscribe members\xa0\xa0

Recommend products and services that complement membership
Make introductions to the Commercial Team, to GMs of other associations and/or to MD, IQ for additional member opportunities.
With MET, deliver $500k uplift annually\xa0


F. Additional responsibilities


Policies, Processes and Procedures
• Adhere to AADL policies and procedures including using and reporting via AADL systems (Salesforce CRM and Wrike). Contribute to improvements or enhancements of processes and systems via feedback and idea generation,

Cross-team Communication
• Communication with other teams as the ‘owner’ of a member contact and company; ensure regular and timely updates to the AADL teams as required
• Developing working relationship and processes with other teams, including Marketing/Communications/Content/Technology/Events

Other Tasks
• Contribute to team and association meetings
• Assist in the answering of the main phone hunt line when required
• Assist Event team members as required
• Any other tasks as they come up from time to time as directed

Employment
• Adhere to the policies laid out in the AADL Employment Handbook

5. PERSONAL SPECIFICATION

EXPERIENCE

  • Previous experience as Telesales or internal sales professional (min 1 year) - Essential
  • Pipeline management, reporting and prospecting - Essential
  • Experience or interest in marketing or advertising - Desirable
  • Ability to coordinate and lead initiatives and multiple tasks concurrently - Essential

SKILLS AND ABILITIES

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills\xa0
  • Ability to take and lead initiatives\xa0
  • Passionate about customer service\xa0
  • Advanced time management skills with an ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously
  • Desire and ability to work to strict deadlines
  • Proactive attitude with ability to deliver results\xa0
  • Focused attention to detail
  • Ability to use and develop networks and contacts with external stake holders
  • Keen desire to know and understand member company, company sector and broad industry information\xa0
  • Able to adapt and develop in a changing environment
  • Ambitious and committed to achieving success

KNOWLEDGE\xa0
  • Basic IT knowledge - Essential
  • Intermediate knowledge of MS Office suite - Essential
  • Experience using Salesforce CRM - Desirable
  • Experience using project management tools such as Wrike - Desirable


EDUCATION/TRAINING

  • Tertiary qualification - Essential
  • Worked within the media/ marketing / advertising/ conference/ exhibition industry


OTHER REQUIREMENTS

  • Strong interpersonal skills- Essential
  • Ability to work independently/without supervision - Essential
  • Champion and uphold AADL's core values - Essential
  • No visa restrictions to work in Australia full-time

    • APM is an Australian owned, international human services organisation with offices across Australia, New Zealand and UK. APM specialises in Employment Services, Injury Management, Vocational Rehabilitation, Assessment, Allied Health Intervention and Community Care.
  • About the Role**:
    • We currently have an opportunity for an Employment Consultant to join the team at our Heidelberg site. This role would ideally suit someone who can demonstrate their ability to create employment opportunities for jobseekers.
  • Core duties of this role include**:
    • Case management of DES job seekers
    Ownership of the entire ES process from initial appointment through to post placement support
    Business development and networking activities to strengthen relationships with local business
    Create employment opportunities for jobseekers
    Working to placement targets and KPI's
  • Skills and Experience**:
    • Proven ability working to targets and KPI's
    Excellent communication skills
    Strong administration and compliance capabilities
    Please note, employment with APM is dependent on the following essential criteria being satisfied: eligibility to work in Australia; current driver's license; access to a comprehensively insured vehicle; national police clearance and working with children check.
  • Benefits and Culture**:
    • Benefits associated with joining APM include but are not limited to, being awarded an attractive salary with uncapped performances incentives, working in a culture that promotes development and inclusion, managing a small caseload and achievable bonuses, career progression opportunities, vehicle salary sacrifice options and personal use of smart phone.
  • Closing date**: This position does not have a closing date for applications. We continually review applications and will close the position when we have identified suitable candidates.
    • If you have the energy and passion for this exciting role, join us on our journey and make a positive difference!
    Indigenous people, people of culturally diverse backgrounds and people with disability are encouraged to apply.

Sales Consultant

Company Name Gym and Fitness Australia Company Location Adelaide, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 9 hours ago Number of views 4 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Do you love fitness and looking for a new career? Gym and Fitness is looking for a bubbly and keen Sales Consultant to work with our awesome Sales Team, working from our head office in Prospect, South Australia. Here at GAF, we live and breathe our core values and purpose, and believe in investing in our team and culture. Our Core Values are Nimbagility, Teamwork, Customer Service, Innovation, Communication and Be the Change You Seek!


Who are we? Gym and Fitness (www.gymandfitness.com.au) is one of Australia's largest fitness equipment ecommerce retailers. We have a team of 40 superstars and an awesome, \xa0driven and fun culture. Being suitable for the role is only half the challenge… we also need someone who will be a great cultural fit and share the same values! Our team receive amazing benefits like gym membership rebate, quarterly team building events, quarterly rewards and much more!


What you will be doing...

You, as our Sales Consultant will be the voice on the other end of the call representing all that is Gym and Fitness. The primary purpose of this position is to sell products and services primarily through the phone and meet customer service objectives. Our mission is to provide convenient access to fitness equipment so all Australians can live longer, healthier and happier lives.


In this role you will ...


  • Build strong customer relationships

  • Manage inbound calls and promotional outbound activities

  • Complete selective outbound calls for new contacts and sales

  • Provide your expertise on our equipment to our customers

  • Perform customer needs analysis

  • Generate and process sales

  • Create customer quotes

  • Organise payment plans

  • Complete follow-ups with customers


Who you will be...

Working as a part of an enthusiastic team, in a highly competitive industry, you will be expected to demonstrate:


  • Passion for fitness and the industry

  • Strong time management and multitasking skills

  • Ability to learn quickly and adapt to a fast - paced environment

  • Willingness to learn and grow within the role and business

  • Willingness to work as a team and operate in line with our purpose and core values

  • High level of customer service


What you will need to have...

  • A can do, get it done attitude

  • Must be legally able to work in Australia

  • Have a good grasp on the English language

  • A high level of computer literacy and experience using CRM's


In return for your hard work and dedication you will receive a salary package + commission + incentives plus the ability to work for an awesome business that genuinely puts their team at the forefront of everything they do.


A quick note…

Slackers and sliders do not fit the mould at Gym and Fitness. Please bring your bag full of energy, enthusiasm and undeniably tough work ethic with you if you want to apply! A good sense of humor is a must and you will need to bring your smile daily! We are too busy having fun and hustling hard to get caught up in office politics and internal mind games. If this sounds like a planet you want to be a part of, spread your wings and hit that apply button right now!


For further information, please contact Bree Fergusson (Executive Assistant to Director / People and Culture Manager) on 0414 567 095.

\xa0

912803101:
[

Digital Marketing Specialist

Company Name PickStar Company Location Adelaide, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 12 hours ago Number of views 28 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

PickStar is the marketplace to book sports stars for any event, marketing campaign or fan experience.

\xa0

One of Australia’s most exciting startups, PickStar is changing the way that brands, agencies, schools, clubs and fans find and book Australia’s sports talent.

\xa0

PickStar’s platform allows clients to choose from 1000+ elite sports talent across all codes and locations, and pitch their request direct to talent – with any budget. Talent respond and apply for client opportunities, and PickStar handles the entire booking process.

\xa0

PickStar has so far facilitated over 1000 commercial deals, partnered with Australia’s top athlete associations and has recently closed a significant funding round.

\xa0

PickStar is expanding rapidly, with plans to fast track growth and launch internationally in 2019.


We are hiring a digital marketing specialist based in Adelaide, South Australia


We require an experienced digital marketer to strategise, create and analyse PickStar’s digital marketing.

\xa0

This is a full time, varied role that will suit a digital marketing allrounder who is data-driven but also relishes the opportunity to be creative and test ideas.

\xa0

You will be responsible for:

\xa0

  • Working with the PickStar marketing team on the development of PickStar’s digital marketing plan, with lead generation as the primary focus
  • Oversee and execute PickStar’s digital marketing plan, including:
    • Building, optimising and analysing Google Ads campaigns
    • Building, optimising and analysing Facebook campaigns, as well as other paid social media campaigns
    • Social media management and content, including posts, images, videos and stories in accordance with the PickStar marketing strategy and brand
    • Development of sports influencer campaigns in accordance with PickStar’s marketing goals and metrics
    • Development of email marketing campaigns, including lead nurturing funnels, database engagement and talent engagement
    • Content creation, including high quality blogs and written content as well as helping facilitate design, audio and video content
    • Google analytics data analysis, including advertising and business performance metrics
    • Working with the development team to improve website SEO and user experience

\xa0

Minimum requirements:

\xa0

  • 3+ years of demonstrated, practical digital marketing experience, INCLUDING building Google Ads and Facebook marketing campaigns from the ground up
  • 3+ years of digital content creation experience e.g. blogs and copywriting, social media content, design
  • Data and results driven
  • Strong communication skills, written and oral
  • Must be based in or willing to relocated to Adelaide, South Australia

\xa0

Desired personal skills and attitude:

\xa0

- Highly motivated with an excellent work ethic

- Reliable and honest

- Fast moving and flexible (things can move and change fast)

- Problem solver .. there’s always a way to get something done!

- Curious and eager to learn

- Team player (we work closely together)

- Deadline orientated

- Fun loving

\xa0

Salary:


60K – 75K + super (depending on experience)


PickStar website:\xa0https://pickstar.com.au/?utm_source=LinkedIn_job_ad

Overview video:\xa0https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kpiD-MmkCOo&utm_source=LinkedIn_job_ad_video
